course_title: SEM: Current Issues in International Intellectual Property Law
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 16 / Seats Avail: 8Waitlist Total: 0 of 3
class_notes: Students must complete the Preselection form to be considered for this class.
course_description:
This seminar will examine special topics and current issues in international intellectual property law relating to patents, trade secrets, designs, copyright, and/or trademarks. Students will explore key provisions of major treaties, emphasizing the implementation and enforcement of the Agreement on Trade Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights (TRIPS), consider new forms of legal protection being considered for traditional knowledge, and the intersection of new technologies with IP protection.
Prerequisites: Intellectual Property Survey or at least one of the stand alone Patent, Trademark, Copyright, or Trade Secret Law courses, or by permission of Professor Bagley.
sections: Class Nbr: 4628, Section #: 001, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: Th 4-6p, Instructor: M. Bagley, Status: Open
